boardgame.name: Cat Power!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The neighbourhood has changed. Power has shifted. Territories have been taken.

There has been a hostile takeover. What was once a patchwork of neighbouring of territories - with boundaries respected, but sometimes tested - is now a single, sweeping zone of terror ruled over by a mysterious new Enemy. Their Agents cover every corner and block the path to their villainous leader.

Old feuds must be forgotten, and disagreements put aside. It’s time for the cats to unite to overthrow this menace and get their gardens back.

Cat Power! is a mini RPG where you play as magical cats trying to get their neighbourhood back.

boardgame.name: 할리갈리 딜럭스 (Halli Galli Deluxe)
boardgame.description:
할리갈리 딜럭스 (Halli Galli Deluxe) is identical to Hali Gali, rule wise. This means you still Flip cards to reveal fruits, and when you spot five of a kind, ring the bell first to win.

However, 할리갈리 딜럭스 contains 75 fruit cards so you can play with up to 7 players.

boardgame.name: Clumsy Heroic Adorable Anticapitalist Penguins Vs Business Goose's Ivory Tower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Business Goose’s Ivory Tower rises above the Tundra, spouting out smog, destroying the ice caps, and hurting the downtrodden Penguins below.

Today, that ends. Today, you will fight your way up through every floor of the Ivory Tower. Today, you will battle past all the Department Heads.

Today, the halls will ring with your battle cries. Today, the tower will fall! NOOT NOOT!

Clumsy Heroic Adorable Anticapitalist Penguins Vs Business Goose's Ivory Tower is a mini RPG. In this dungeon waddling game, you take on the evil Business Goose to save the Antarctic from his capitalist clutches.

As you waddle your way up the tower, the only thing standing in the way of your success is your clumsiness... and penguins are VERY clumsy!
boardgame.rpg: Clumsy Heroic Adorable Anticapitalist Penguins Vs Business Goose's Ivory Tower

boardgame.name: Coin Toss Horror Hunter
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Coin Toss Horror Hunter is a mini RPG, where players take on the role of Horror Hunters travelling from town to town on their bandwagon in search of coins.

You’re a gang of mutants who roam the land hunting Horrors. Your reward? Sweet, sweet coins. You love coins. So much. They’re pretty much all you live for.

The townsfolk don’t always like you, but when you and your fellow Horror Hunters roll into town on your bandwagon, they’ll give you coins to get rid of whatever Horror is ruining their day! COINS!

boardgame.name: Dinosaur Riders In Space
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

IN THE FAR FUTURE, THE GALAXY IS A THRIVING MASS OF CONNECTED COLONIES. THE GALACTIC IMPERIUM CONTROLS AND SANCTIONS SHIPPING, MINING, AND TRADE. THE INNER HELIX OF PLANETS IS A HIGH-COST, ELITIST, AND HEAVILY POLICED REGION.

IN THE FURTHEST REACHES, THERE IS CHAOS - OR AT LEAST THAT’S WHAT THE IMPERIUM WOULD HAVE YOU BELIEVE. THE RIOTOUS SWIRLING OF THE VOID BEYOND PROVIDES A BEAUTIFUL, MELTING, AND DANGEROUS BACKDROP AS DINOSAUR-RIDING PIRATES CRUISE BETWEEN ABANDONED WORLDS, CRUMBLING SPACE HULKS, AND OVERPOPULATED SPACE STATIONS WHICH HOUSE THE MOST DIVERSE AND COLOURFUL EXAMPLES OF THE GALACTIC POPULATION.

Dinosaur Riders In Space is a game of uninhibited interstellar action, sexy space lasers, attaining adoration and glory, and making sweet, sweet cash at any cost.

Make enemies, make friends, make love, but most of all, make a name for yourselves. Only the greatest of outlaws go down in history and fortune favours the brave!

In Dinosaur Riders In Space, players team up - with one player taking the role of Rider and one the role of Dinosaur - to create teams of space pirates who are willing to achieve fame at any cost.

boardgame.name: droWWord
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Drow - sometimes known as Trow or Dtrow - are mischievous sprites with pale skin and dark hair that inhabit the Orkney Islands. At night, when the moonlight paints the earth, they emerge from their drowie knowes to sneak into nearby towns, causing mischief and stealing items to take home to their burrows. They love music and are particularly beguiled by songs and stories, drawing the power for their tricksy magick from written and spoken words. As they run through the darkened streets and across the wild cliffs, they draw letters from their sporrans to cast spells on those who would spot them or stand in their way.

droWWord is a mini RPG that uses Scrabble tiles instead of dice, where you play as naughty dark elves trying to steal as many shiny trinkets as possible!

boardgame.name: Fine Familiars
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Life is hard as a Familiar. You’re just trying to get things done on your own plane of existence when, without warning, you’re dragged away to take part in some magic user’s adventure.

When Familiars are summoned, they’re pulled from their original plane of existence and into the Material Plane. Familiars are given whatever form the spellcaster chooses and forced to take part in a quest until they’re dismissed, or their material form is destroyed.

What most people don’t know is that Familiars have no control over their own ability to change their form. When they’re returned to their original plane of existence, they’re stuck in the last form they were given by their summoner. This can cause all sorts of problems if you’re in the middle of a task.

They could be on the Material Plane for minutes, hours, weeks, or years, depending on how long they’re needed, but the good news is, when they’re returned to their home plane, no time has passed at all. If only it weren’t so disorientating!

Fine Familiars is a mini RPG where you play as Familiars, constantly being summoned away in the middle of a task and given a different, frustrating form.

boardgame.name: Lycantropes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lycantropes is a game where you play as your favourite Werewolf movie tropes, hang out in London, and just try to have a nice day.

Werewolves have had a lot of bad press in the last few thousand years. If they go out in public, they’re hunted and killed. To make matters worse, TFL (Transport for London) recently banned Werewolves from the London Underground. That kind of oppression can really grind you down.

Most Werewolves turn to a support group for comfort and help in the darker times. You and your Werewolf Support Group buddies have decided to go out for the day in London.

There’s a Wolf Kahn exhibit on at the Tate Modern, but the only time you could get tickets was during THE FULL MOON!

Around the full moon, it gets harder to control your human form and when things go wrong, you get a little feral…

Pick any train station in London as your starting point, travel across the city, remain undetected, and try to have a lovely day out.

By ANY MEANS POSSIBLE.

boardgame.name: Noire: Elle Est, Elles Sont
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Noire: Elle Est, Elles Sont is a mini RPG where you play as a group of Femmes Fatales, trying to uncover the truth behind the disappearance of an alcoholic detective.

boardgame.name: Rob-0h No!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rob-0h No! is a mini RPG, where players take on the role of robot trash sheriffs, trying to clean up the town and take out the robo mafia. Upgrade as you go and overcome your flaws.

Welcome to MALWHERE - a town of corrupted hard drives and corrupt politicians. This place is a mess and there’s junk everywhere, but the real trash is other robots and you’re here to clean up. The Robo-mafia have their claws dug in deep and it’s time for a change.

You are tiny, flawed trash Sheriffs with a passion for solving crimes & taking names. You and your Robot companions are ready to access the town’s memories of when things were different and RAM justice down the throats of the bad guys. You may not be perfect, you may have your flaws, you may be a little broken, but you’re all this town has got.

It’s time to get to work...

boardgame.name: S.C.R.E.A.M: The Horror
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It’s your favourite Slasher movie come to life – take on the role of doomed characters and make every mistake in the book.

Go off alone, tell your friends you’ll ‘Be Right Back’, investigate that spooky sound, engage in vices, do all of the stuff you’d scream at the Characters on-screen for doing in real life.

Be brave. Be sexy. Be dumb.

There will be blood. Your blood.

In S.C.R.E.A.M: The Horror, players are encouraged to act foolishly and put themselves in danger, just like characters in a horror movie, but this time, death is not the end! Whenever a character dies, they join the GM in being 'The Horror' and everything gets more dangerous for the surviving characters.

boardgame.name: Supernormal
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You’ve got SUPERPOWERS.

Like, REAL SUPERPOWERS. But… What about when you want a day off?

Your SUPERPOWERS are great for fighting crime and saving the world, but just trying to kick back and blend in is really tough.

You’re super strong, with crazy fast reactions and a body of steel, but your powers are a little unstable and you really struggle to dial down the Super when interacting with everyday objects, people, or situations. How are you going to cope with keeping your secret identity hidden and still have a nice day off?

In SUPERNORMAL, you and your SUPER friends attempt to blend in and just get on with a normal day, whilst trying to suppress your unstable SUPERPOWERS.
boardgame.rpgpodcastepisode: The Adventure Zone: Just Us

boardgame.name: This Has Made Monsters of Us
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You awake in a shallow grave. Your nails scratch at the coffin lid above you and the beating of your fists breaks the rotting wood. Your fingers part the perfumed earth.
The night air is cold and tastes of blood and longing. You can smell the soil in your nostrils and something else, something... New.

Around you, you hear fingernails breaking as your new siblings claw their way to the surface around you. Something in you has changed. You are not what you once were...

You are a brood, now. United in death. You desire, as one, to hunt for the one who made you this way, though you do not know why or to what end.

At night, The Hunt awakes and you are compelled to find them. In the day, the feeling weakens and you may strive to keep what is left of your humanity intact.

This Has Made Monsters Of Us is a mini RPG where players take on the role of the recently deceased. As you hunt and your siblings hunt for your killer, you must try to balance your hunt for revenge and your dwindling humanity.
boardgame.rpg: This Has Made Monsters of Us

boardgame.name: This Is a Sad Place, Where Ghosts Live
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a house, where ghosts live.
It houses the living, who are sad.
Their sadness feeds sadness. Their fear breeds fear.
This house has ghosts, who are not sad.
Their successes cause joy. Their failures cause sadness.
Their triumphs instill courage. Their blunders instill fear.
This is a sad place, where ghosts live.

This Is A Sad Place, Where Ghosts Live is a mini RPG where you play a group of ghosts, haunting a house where sadness resides.

Try to influence the living world as best you can, but beware - interacting with the real world is tricky and things can go wrong!
boardgame.rpg: This is a Sad Place, Where Ghosts Live

boardgame.name: What Have You Done? Run, Nun, Run!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Alarms are going off. The building is on fire. You’re in an alley, covered in blood...

What have you done? RUN, NUN, RUN!

In What Have You Done? RUN, NUN, RUN! Players take on the roles of Nuns who have just committed a terrible crime. The Nuns know what they did, but none of the players do, yet…

Escape the law with help from Above, or Below, and slowly piece together what it was you did as you make your way to safety.
boardgame.rpg: What Have You Done? Run, Nun, Run!

boardgame.name: 100 Phobias
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides 100 different phobias that a player character or NPC might have. This guide is reasonably universal (with exception of a few entries), allowing the GM the ability to use it with a variety of different genres.

boardgame.name: Village of Blackthorn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This part of town has seen better days. The tavern which was built long ago now sits at the very edge of the cliff, warmth and the scent of freshly baked goods wafting from it’s windows. There is also an alchemists store, weapons store and a small library tended to by one of the towns monks.

Many of the buildings hold stairways down to storage basements or further rooms below which also connect up to the towns sewers. In the subbasement there are multiple rooms which are semi-lived in including a secret shrine.

Adventure Seed

Half a dozen children have gone missing from their homes over the last few months and one distraught mother has begged you to investigate. The disappearances have been worsening and they believe something needs to be done about it—no one else in the village will search for the children and the guards haven’t been able to find anything.

She suspects a cult is behind it, but you need to be discrete when you look into it. Most of the villagers are too scared to speak about it and if any of the zealots get word that you’re asking questions you might be ambushed and taken yourself.

What’s happening? Foreigners arrived in this village a little over a year ago and began preaching their strange religion on the streets. No-one thought anything of it then, but now the religion has spread and the increasing disappearances of children are just the beginning.

The children, however, are actually choosing to convert to the religion, following the priests down into the sewers where they are treated well and given more food than they could dream of (covertly supplied by the town’s Innkeeper).

However, something more insidious is happening. Once down there, the children are not permitted to leave and while they’re being treated well the priest intends to use them as vessels for a demonic ritual practiced by his religion.

boardgame.name: Wintersreach Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This part of town has seen better days. The tavern which was built long ago now sits at the very edge of the cliff, warmth and the scent of freshly baked goods wafting from it’s windows. There is also an alchemists store, weapons store and a small library tended to by one of the towns monks.

Many of the buildings hold stairways down to storage basements or further rooms below which also connect up to the towns sewers. In the subbasement there are multiple rooms which are semi-lived in including a secret shrine.

She suspects a cult is behind it, but you need to be discrete when you look into it. Most of the villagers are too scared to speak about it and if any of the zealots get word that you’re asking questions you might be ambushed and taken yourself.

However, something more insidious is happening. Once down there, the children are not permitted to leave and while they’re being treated well the priest intends to use them as vessels for a demonic ritual practiced by his religion.

boardgame.name: Town of Seacliff
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This part of town has seen better days. The tavern which was built long ago now sits at the very edge of the cliff, warmth and the scent of freshly baked goods wafting from it’s windows. There is also an alchemists store, weapons store and a small library tended to by one of the towns monks.

Many of the buildings hold stairways down to storage basements or further rooms below which also connect up to the towns sewers. In the subbasement there are multiple rooms which are semi-lived in including a secret shrine.

Adventure Seed

The disappearances have been worsening and they believe something needs to be done about it—no one else in the village will search for the children and the guards haven’t been able to find anything.

She suspects a cult is behind it, but you need to be discrete when you look into it. Most of the villagers are too scared to speak about it and if any of the zealots get word that you’re asking questions you might be ambushed and taken yourself.

What’s happening? Foreigners arrived in this village a little over a year ago and began preaching their strange religion on the streets. No-one thought anything of it then, but now the religion has spread and the increasing disappearances of children are just the beginning.

The children, however, are actually choosing to convert to the religion, following the priests down into the sewers where they are treated well and given more food than they could dream of (covertly supplied by the town’s Innkeeper).

However, something more insidious is happening. Once down there, the children are not permitted to leave and while they’re being treated well the priest intends to use them as vessels for a demonic ritual practiced by his religion.

boardgame.name: Mega Station X - Asteroid Bunker
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mega Station X – Asteroid Bunker is an ultra-massive 340 x 340 grid map comprised of 100 34 x34 unique geomorphic interlocking maps (each section can be rotated 90-degrees in any direction as well as inverted to link directly to any other map in the series).

To scale, using all 100 maps in a 10 x 10 array, Mega Station X creates an incredibly huge 2,890,00 square-foot space station map. Over ¾ of square kilometer consisting of over 3,500 individual rooms and hundreds of miles of networked corridors.

This product contains both High-Resolution (5,100 x 5,100 px 600 dpi] and VTT-Ready (1,800 x 1,800 px @ 300 dpi) versions of all 100 maps. Can be used to make multiple smaller maps or virtually endless combinations of massive maps. Corner and edge-cap maps also included.

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 272 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue 272
2020

Super Anniversary Issue
Celebrating 30 Years

boardgame.name: Odd Realm
boardgame.description:
Take control of a group of settlers to build a settlement that survives the passing seasons, roaming bandits, underground horrors, and gods from legend.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 273 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue 273
2020

The Bridge of Woe

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 274 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue 274
2020

The Hacky Bunch

boardgame.name: Fogbound
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Daniel Kinkaid, a former burglar now trying to go straight, has suddenly vanished. His brother Steven suspects his disappearance has something to do with the recent theft of an antique map from a local museum, and the strange woman Daniel had started seeing in the weeks leading up to the theft. Steven turns to friends of his who have a knack for investigating strange occurrences: the player characters.

boardgame.name: Lock-in: Five in a Bunker
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Five strangers awaken in a locked bunker. They have no memory of who they are, or what they are doing here. Only that they must get out. Something hungry waits for them...

boardgame.name: The Transmigration of the Emerald Lama
boardgame.description:
An adventure for the Secrets of Japan setting

From the introduction:

An investigator is approached by a handsome Japanese businessman during a school excursion at the Motonosumi Inari Shrine in Nagato. He tells him that it’s time to come back to his own people. That night, the investigator starts having strange dreams involving a green light coming out of vermilion torii gates. It’s up to him and his high school friends to find out what it all means!

boardgame.name: Expendable Implements
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Consumable magic items are a staple of treasure hoards since the dawn of adventuring, and for good reason. They can be a fun tool for the players to use, but since they are expandable, they tend not to overwhelm the game if you give them out generously.

boardgame.name: Mythical Things of Theros
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement lists 50 magical items (plus 5 cursed items and 5 common trinkets) from the mythical setting of Theros.

boardgame.name: Realm Events
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

All too often, we forget that the world spins on around the adventurers and their quests. That world is full of vibrant life and events that can impact the adventurers’ life.

This book is written for those who love random events and encounters.

boardgame.name: Wizard School of Awakening
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

How to make new friends. See the mundane objects around you for their true potential.

boardgame.name: Waterdeep: The Plowing and Running
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The city of Waterdeep is well known for its citizens’ fondness for celebration. Barely a tenday passes without at least one festival taking place within the City of Splendors. Near mid-spring, during the month of Mirtul, one such occasion is celebrated by friendly competition between the different wards of the city. While the Plowing and Running holiday originated to celebrate the plowing of fields and running of livestock in rural areas, the metropolis of Waterdeep holds a series of foot, horse, and chariot races throughout the multi-day event.

boardgame.name: The Consort
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A young elf hoists their shield high before setting their sword ablaze with a ferocious yellow fire. The impending horde of undead have met their match, for none can harm their beloved.
...
A fey companion class.

boardgame.name: The Rules of Cool Characters
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Everything you need to portray characters who are just... cool!

boardgame.name: Trio of Light
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Three New Prism Subclasses: Ally Facet, Flame Facet, and Fractured Facet

boardgame.name: Prismatic Ally
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A sidekick option for the Prism class.

User summary:

This item is intended for use with Light & Magic: Prism

boardgame.name: Prisms of Eberron
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Contained herein are lore and rules for playing the Prism class in the Eberron campaign setting.

User summary:

This item is intended for use with Light & Magic: Prism

boardgame.name: Release the Krakin
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Take the plunge and uncover new options.

User summary:

This sourcebook presents a variety of game options involving underwater adventuring and, especially, the Krakin.

boardgame.name: New Pokémon Snap
boardgame.description: New Pokémon Snap seems to follow closely in it’s predecessors footsteps, featuring an updated list of Pokémon across multiple generations, new environments, and, of course, modern visuals.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 The Game Awards Best Family Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Tom's Party
boardgame.description:
Today is Tom the mouse's birthday and his friends are preparing a surprise birthday party. Place the different elements and guests in the party before Tom appears. If he arrives early, quickly release a ballon so that he can linger to play with it, and you'll have time to finish the surprise.

Cooperation game.
All the guests and elements of the party are inside of a bag, all the players, one by one, should extract one wooden piece from the bag, if it's a guest or an element, we are preparing the party, but if we take Tom, then we use one of the four balloons then he can linger to play with it. We have 4 balloons.
If we can put all the guest before we use the four balloons, then we win, otherwise we lose.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bearzzz
boardgame.description:
Mmmm, the honey's delicious. Help Little Bear to take 5 pots of honey from the kitchen while Mummy Bear sleeps on her rocking chair. But be careful, because some noises could make Mummy Bear wake up and catch us.

Roll the dice to know the color of the cards we should flip, if it's a honey pot, Great!!, if it's something which make noise, Carefull!!, because that could make Mummy Bear wake up, but if we flip the card with no noise, then Mummy Bear will sleeps again.
We will win if we get all the honey pots before bear Mum wake up, otherwise, we lose.
It's a cooperation game for 2+

boardgame.name: Abandon All Artichokes: Rhubarb Promo
boardgame.description:
Set of six Rhubarb cards for the game Abandon All Artichokes.

Compost this card to refresh the Garden Row, then harvest a card (Place old cards under Garden Stack.)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Chaf Chof
boardgame.description:
Chaf Chof is a game of agility and vistual speed. Throw the dice and be the quickest to find the card with the same combination of the animals or colours. You can play with colours or shapes and the instructions also include a playing variant from 2 years old.
If the combination of colours or animals is not on the table, the first one who see it, can say it and take this card from the deck of the player who took it.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bed Bugs
boardgame.description:
There's a plague of bed bugs in teh house and we have to trap them with our different body parts, even if we end up in almost impossible positions. But if you also want to win more points you'll have to perform the action that appears on the card without dropping any bed bugs. Don't stay in your seat!
In each card you can see where you should put the bed bugs in your body, the first one to put the bed bugs in the correct place, should ring the bell and can decide if he win this card or want to win extra card doing the action of the extra card.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Brutal Tender
boardgame.description:
CONTEXT
Imagine a rainbow Ring with nice things running all over in it. It's full of cuteness, except that there should only be one when the rain stops reflecting the sunlight. A bit like when the cops ​​charge at gay pride, the color gives way to the horror ... and you can then smell the scent of death, wet of course like it just rained. It's kind of a Royal Rumble of the Nice things, the last one that survives, survives, and the others ...
Note that these nice things eat so much corn that they poop popcorn in each square when they leave. Unfortunately for them, but fortunately for the show, it is so GMO the corn that when there is too much concentration on a small surface, well it poops the Bad thing!

HOW TO PLAY
- Move your TENDER in the Ring and poop CORN in each square you leave
- Form pentagrams with your CORN in order to poop your BRUTAL
- Use GUTS from wounded TENDER in order to poop more brutal BRUTAL
- Kill other TENDER with your BRUTAL before they kill you

CONTENT
Print and Play Game
1 RING
4 TENDER
8 BRUTAL
7 WEAPONS
64 CORNS & 1 DOUBLE CORN
7 GUTS
RULES BOOKLET

This game exist in two sides:
Brutal Dinos Tender Unicorns & Brutal Unicorns Tender Dinos. It's up to you to decide who will be the helpless beings!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Crazy Food
boardgame.description:
In Crazy Food you have to be the quickest to grab the food needed to solve the puzzle on each card.
Work out the next in the sequence and gab the fruit before anyone else
The first to get five points wins.
Each card has a sequence, the first who take the correct color or shape of the fruit to continue the sequence win one point.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monkey's Forest
boardgame.description:
Become a monkey and collect as much fruit as you can and brint it to your tree, but be careful with the transport, as the more you bring, the more danger these is of one of them falling on the way there.
Thru the dice and take one or two fruits, lose one fruit or win extra fruit in your pile, you win the fruits when you bring them to your tree.
Win who has more fruits in his tree.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Emo Park
boardgame.description:
Action and observation game, using the you must describe the cards using the emotions, but without suing the prohibited words, the first one to find the scene on the board, will win the card.
Also, you'll find some recommendations for using this game with adults (parents, educators, ...)

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ring Win
boardgame.description:
Find the right animal before the others and put it into the compound.
Be the quickest to find the animals which have escaped from the farm, take them back and put them in the compound. Hold them firmly, because if you drop them you'll lose the card.
Flip one card with animal and another with color, the first player find it and ring the bell, win the card and should put it in his body as per card instructions.
The winner is who has 5 cards.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Memorizzers
boardgame.description:
New observation game which use the classic board game and App.
Different categories and levels of difficult depending on the age of the players. All can play with the same options to win.
The App shows one picture during few seconds, you should remember all the details and answer the question of the app.
Win who arrives first at the end of the board answering the questions of the app.

boardgame.name: Modular Parcheesi
boardgame.description:
The modules mean up to 8 players can take part in the most fun positions. The 2 octogonal centran anchoring pieces mean that two different groups can play at the same time.
The instructions are the same as for the classic version of Parcheesi, though if only two people are playing we recomment halving the score when you get "home" and when you land your opponent.
The cards of the pieces are reversible, with numbers on one side (for 8 players version) and non on the other, for when pieces are removed on reducing the number of players.

boardgame.name: Pingüi Land
boardgame.description:
All of us have to make sure that Pingüi reaches the iceberg before the snow monster in order to escape the island and not get caught in the avalanche.
Cooperation game, to win the game, we should bring the penguin to the Iceberg before the avalanche catch us or before the Snow Monster arrives to the Iceberg before the penguin.

boardgame.name: Claim Kingdoms: Royal Edition
boardgame.description:
You rule over a small region in a deserted corner of the kingdom. It is time to change that and expand your influence. You travel across the land and try to convince the different factions to join your side. Play the game of domination wisely, win enough factions for your course and you will soon rule over the kingdom!

Claim Kingdoms Royal Edition is an updated extended version with over 30 unique factions. The game gets even more challenging with the War Maps having special action fields which have new abilities. Will the Farm work in your favour or are you gonna lose points? Especially at the ruins, you don’t know which treasure you will find.
Claim Kingdoms Royal Edition has an easy setup: Choose your factions, put the number of war maps equal to the number of players on the table and the battle of power can begin! What is your strategy to win over the different factions?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sam the villain
boardgame.description:
In Sam the Villain, all the players are the police and we have to catch the thief before he commits his last 4 robberies and scapes to a lost island with all his loot.
Cooperation game.
Each player roll his dice and has 1 minute to find his object in the board, if he find it, then can help the rest of the players to find their own objects, but using only words to describe the situation.

boardgame.name: Pirates Adventure
boardgame.description:
Which team of shipwrecked pirates will arrive first to the island and will build a pirate ship to continue on with their adventures?
Two pirate ships have been shipwrecked and its crew has to get to an island that they see in the distance and try to build a new ship to be able to return home.
Each team should pass the challenges as paint, define or imitate, if they pass the challenge, win a coin, at the end of the road, if the team has 10 coins, can buy the pieces to build the ship.
In this game, the board is the floor of the house and the chips are the players.

boardgame.name: How Am I Weird
boardgame.description:
How Am I Weird is a simple, fun party game to play with family and friends, in a group of 3 - 10. There are LIFE cards, COMEBACK cards and blank WEIRDO cards. LIFE cards present situations, sometimes awkward or embarrassing, sometimes annoying or familiar. COMEBACK cards present responses that are weird and wonderful. One person is nominated the Big Weird Chief, and the rest of the players each take 8 COMEBACK cards and one blank WEIRDO card. The Big Weird Chief reads a LIFE card. Each player chooses the weirdest and funniest COMEBACK response, or comes up with their own answer using their WEIRDO card! The person who gives the weirdest and funniest answer wins that round. At the end of the game, the player who has won the most rounds wins the game, and becomes ruler of the universe. Then you should WEAR THE CROWN!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Killer Bunnies Omega Series Promo Cards
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot

boardgame.name: Numberella
boardgame.description:
Numberella is table top game involving cards, wooden Antcoins, jewels, dice and a sand timer. The game is based around a combination of arithmetic / word problem / stacking questions, on Game Cards - correct answers earn you Antcoins - and luck, which comes from Fortune Cards.

Fortune cards allow players to hijack each other's turns, (Harry Hijack) get money from the bank,(Jin Genie) make each other miss their goes,(Miss A. Go) and steal each other's money (The Thief.) A blocking card (Ronnie Resist) allows players to defend themselves. You get a new fortune card every time you cash in 100 Antcoins with the bank. Fortune cards are also interspersed with game cards. The person with the most money when the time is up, wins.

The aim of the game is to have fun and get better at math. The game is based around the UK and US math curricula, and as such is suitable for use in an educational setting. It is available in 3 Levels of difficulty.

It has become curriculum for gifted students in some US counties, but it is also widely used in Special Ed / SEND classrooms, including psychiatric homes.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Virtual Reef Diver
boardgame.description:
Experience the beauty and wonder of the Great Barrier Reef while learning about the dangers this national treasure currently faces, and the solutions data scientists are providing for its defence. Work as a team of citizen scientists on a quest to classify the corals, identify the organisms, and help protect the seventh wonder of the natural world.

The game features fast paced gameplay (pick a card and identify it for points), beautiful reef imagery and educational content.

Sales of this game directly contribute towards future print runs of this game as it is a not for profit.

Virtual Reef Diver is based on an Australian Government-funded citizen science website, where people can go to play a digital version and contribute useful data to scientists across Australia and across the world!

Whether for teaching, learning or just for fun, Virtual Reef Diver has plenty to offer everyone.

boardgame.name: Cuac!
Duck
Kaczki
Утки
boardgame.description:
Push your luck at this fast paced, family-friendly card game.

Take risks by keeping a very high card or by "DUCKing": If you duck, you are betting, that you have the lowest sum in hand. At the end of the round, the player with the highest sum in hand scores … nothing.

—description from the designer

Lulu, Sonny and Duke take part in the great duck race. Play your hand cards cleverly and draw only cards that are of advantage to you for your next turn. Watch your opponents closely – the first player to play all his cards wins the round and earns valuable points. Will you play quickly but cleverly? Or will you be bold enough to duck down and exit the round? And if you do, will you really have the lowest total in your hand? Who will duck down most quickly and thus gain the most victory points?

—description from the publisher

Lulu, Sonny und Duke chillen am Strand und warten auf die nächste große Welle. Spiele zügig deine Handkarten aus und beobachte deine Gegner genau.Oder passe den richtigen Moment ab und DUCKe dich geschickt, bevor es die anderen
tun. Denn wenn du alle unterbietest holst du dir wertvolle Siegpunkte. Handkarten abspielen oder clever DUCKen … was ist dein Move?

—description from the publisher (German)

boardgame.name: Pio Fiore: Fated Memories
Piofiore Fated Memories
Piofiore: Fated Memories
Pious Flower: Fated Memories
ピオフィオーレの晩鐘 -Ricardo-
boardgame.description:
Navigate a world of organized crime...

Piofiore: Fated Memories follows Liliana Adornato, who was born and raised in the church in the center of the Italian town of Burlone. Three criminal organizations control parts of the city, and Lili discovers that she is in the center of their deadly turf wars. Her encounters with the leaders of the Falzone, Visconti, and Lao-Shu Families lead to danger and distraction. Drawn into the shadowy world of organized crime, she realizes there is no going back.

Navigate organizations riddled with intrigue and betrayal as three mafia families fight for honor and control.
Unlock additional story options, new perspectives, and deeper, deadlier secrets as you complete the game multiple times.
Experience gorgeous music and artwork depicting the sun drenched (and sin-filled) world of early 1900’s Italy.

boardgame.name: Kotostrofa
boardgame.description:
Kotostrofa is a fast-paced family game of logic and reaction.
This game is about two prankish cats - Marsik and Murzik! - that have soft fur and lovely faces, but they really like to cheat. Today they have made a very "CATastrophe" in the house!

The goal of the game is to figure out the prankish cat before the other participants do and grab the correct figure. To do this, players simultaneously compare the pictures on the cards of the son and the daughter and determine which of the cats is more common. The cats are so easy to confuse!

How to play:

Spot the misdeed card and find out what happened.
Turn over the cards of the son and the daughter and discover which of the cats is more often found on flipped cards. Be the first to grab the right cat figure!
If there is an image of crying children on the cards, grab the ice cream or the doll figure to earn extra Victory Points. 



—description from the designer

Котострофа - быстрая семейная игра на логику и реакцию.
Это игра про двух котов-проказников - Марсика и Мурзика! У них мягкая шёрстка и умильные мордочки, но они очень любят похулиганить. Вот и сегодня они устроили в доме настоящую "котострофу".

Цель игры - быстрее других участников вычислить кота-проказника и схватить нужную фигурку. Для этого игроки одновременно сравнивают картинки на карточках мальчика и девочки и определяют, какой из котов встречается чаще. Этих котов так легко перепутать!

Как играть
1.Откройте карточку беспорядка и узнайте, что случилось.
2. Одновременно переверните карточки сына и дочки и посчитайте, кто из котов чаще встречается на открытых карточках. Постарайтесь первым схватить нужную фигурку кота.
3. Если на карточках встречается изображение плачущих детей, хватайте фигурки мороженного или куклы, чтобы заработать дополнительные победные очки.

—description from the designer (Russian)

boardgame.name: Black Rose Wars: Summonings – Undead
boardgame.description:
Summonings is a series of three all-miniature expansions for Black Rose Wars, which introduces three kinds of summoning creatures: Constructs, Undead, and Demons.

Summonings: Undead is one of these miniature expansions, featuring a set of summoned creatures which your mage can bring into play. Previously only available in the Kickstarter version of the game, these beautiful figures are now available to upgrade and visually enhance the Black Rose Wars Core Game. They are also a great complement to any fantasy role-playing game.

Each set of miniatures is vastly different from the others. The Undead allow players to lead their personal army of loyal skeleton warriors, composed by 11 incredible miniatures: Landsknechts (x8, 45mm) and Bone Knights (x3, 50mm).

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
[size=14][b][u]Comments:[/u][/b][/size]
To see other titles that I have for sale (and perhaps mitigate shipping costs) enter the following into your browser: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/Paladin82Y . Note that I am not a store but just a gamer like you (although one that lost his mind and purchased waaaay too many games over the last 30 years). I have tried to accurately describe my offerings from a gamer's perspective. If you are a collector or re-seller and need more details, just let me know. In general, I'm mindful about the condition of my games while playing, but I am not a rabid preservationist... I often discard advertisements and inserts (so please assume that if an insert was originally included in the box that it is gone - if an insert is important to you, please ask about it). Furthermore, most played games (with cards) were sleeved during play... but unless specifically and explicitly noted otherwise, any sleeves will have been removed before the game was offered for sale.
[size=14][b][u]Condition Notes:[/u][/b][/size] Smoke-free home. Unpunched/uncut/unused/unplayed (but this version was not distributed in a sealed package and does not have its own box).
[b][u]Edition Notes:[/u][/b] English. Signed by Jeffrey Neil Bellinger (Designer)
[size=14][b][u]Shipping Notes:[/u][/b][/size] Ask me about how you can create an order where there will be no charge to ship this item as an add-on item if you purchase a big-box game at the same time.
I am willing to meet you at one of the many local Game Nights close to Waukee, IA (see https://www.boardgamegeek.com/guild/1365) to make the exchange in person which would reduce your shipping cost to $0.00. Otherwise--Yes, I will gladly combine orders to reduce your per-item shipping costs. (To see other items to add to your order see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/Paladin82Y).
When placing an order, please provide a contact phone number--this is ONLY in case there are shipping issues--I am NOT planning to call you. Also, please provide a direct/external (non-BGG) email address.
Finally, if at all possible, please provide a business (rather than a residential) shipping address and let me know that the address you are providing is a business address (this may expedite delivery).
[size=14][b][u]Payment Notes:[/u][/b][/size] **Note that the listed offered price includes a small discount for a cash (cash, money order, Amazon Gift Card, western union) payment. I cannot include the discount for payments made via Paypal.
[b][i]US buyers:[/i][/b] When placing the order, let me know if you would like to purchase the optional insurance offered by the shipping company. I cannot remember ever having any material problems, but theoretically there is some risk. If the receiver (you) does NOT request (and does NOT pay extra for) insurance (decision is totally up to you) then the receiver (you) agrees to assume responsibility for lost or damaged packages. I know that this paragraph sounds scary, but my lawyer makes me include this -- again, this is probably a non-issue -- I have never had a package that I shipped go missing and think that I have had two people mention extremely minor blemishes incurred during shipping in the last 600 BGG items that I have shipped. See the [i][b]Info from Seller[/b][/i] Section below for more critically important details on payment options.
[b][i]non-US buyers:[/i][/b] See the [i][b]Info from Seller[/b][/i] Section below for more critically important details on shipping and payment options.

boardgame.description:
On an uninhabited island in uncharted seas, explorers have found traces of a great civilization. Now you will lead an expedition to explore the island, find lost artifacts, and face fearsome guardians, all in a quest to learn the island's secrets.

Lost Ruins of Arnak combines deck-building and worker placement in a game of exploration, resource management, and discovery. In addition to traditional deck-builder effects, cards can also be used to place workers, and new worker actions become available as players explore the island. Some of these actions require resources instead of workers, so building a solid resource base will be essential. You are limited to only one action per turn, so make your choice carefully... what action will benefit you most now? And what can you afford to do later... assuming someone else doesn't take the action first!?

Decks are small, and randomness in the game is heavily mitigated by the wealth of tactical decisions offered on the game board. With a variety of worker actions, artifacts, and equipment cards, the set-up for each game will be unique, encouraging players to explore new strategies to meet the challenge.

Discover the Lost Ruins of Arnak!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A Warm and Pleasant Hum
boardgame.description:
From the itch.io page:
The human world has room for many monarchs, but The Humming Woods has only one Queen. This six-legged Mother of Millions dines exclusively on an elixir said to cure any ill, or even extend one's life... a royal jelly of matchless quality. Few dare attempt to steal any jelly away, protected as it is by the swarms that live in Her remote hive, The Six-Form Heart.

But what if one had grander dreams than of a waxed sack of purloined jelly?

In this Trophy Dark incursion, your treasure-hunters will journey into a dark and bee-filled wood in search of their dearest desire... but will find nothing but destruction.

A WARM AND PLEASANT HUM is a prize-winning entry from 2019's official Trophy Writing Contest. Judge Jason Cordova (Gauntlet) called it "both beautiful and terrifying."

boardgame.name: Affection Game
boardgame.description:
From the itch.io page:

You and your companion(s) awaken in a realm unlike your own.

Divine machines glitter from every side of the room, and ask about yourself and those around you.

To make it back home, answer them honestly and reveal your truth to not just the automatons… but to the partner(s) you are sitting with.

The only way to win is to be vulnerable.

boardgame.name: Black Rose Wars: Summonings – Constructs
boardgame.description:
Summonings is a series of three all-miniature expansions for Black Rose Wars, which introduces three kinds of summoning creatures: Constructs, Undead, and Demons.

Summonings: Constructs is one of these miniature expansions, featuring a set of summoned creatures which your mage can bring into play. Previously only available in the Kickstarter version of the game, these beautiful figures are now available to upgrade and visually enhance the Black Rose Wars Core Game. They are also a great complement to any fantasy role-playing game.

Each set of miniatures is vastly different from the others. The Constructs give a concrete form to your Transmutation, Divination and Illusion magic, with 13 highly detailed miniatures, subdivided in the Divine Altar (x 5, 30mm), Mutant Altar (x 5, 30mm), and Andromeda (x 3, 50mm).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Black Rose Wars: Summonings – Demons
boardgame.description:
Summonings is a series of three all-miniature expansions for Black Rose Wars, which introduces three kinds of summoning creatures: Constructs, Undead, and Demons.

Summonings: Demons is one of these miniature expansions, featuring a set of summoned creatures which your mage can bring into play. Previously only available in the Kickstarter version of the game, these beautiful figures are now available to upgrade and visually enhance the Black Rose Wars Core Game. They are also a great complement to any fantasy role-playing game.

Each set of miniatures is vastly different from the others. Last, but not least, there are the Demons, who the players summon from the flames of hell and bind to their will. In this “hellish” set, there are 6 big miniatures, Cerbero (x 3, 60mm) and Malacoda (x 3, 70mm).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Quartermaster General (Second Edition): Total War
Quartermaster General 2ème GM: La Guerre Totale
主計将校：総力戦 拡張
쿼터마스터 제너럴: 총력전
boardgame.description:
Total War is the first expansion for the second edition of Quartermaster General, that provides players with a great number of new playing options, without dramatically increasing the play time.

Among these new game features, the most important is the introduction of Air Forces that brings a whole new dimension to the conflict. Air Forces help the players to defend Armies and Navies in the same space, or to attack adjacent Air Forces in battle.

Another new key feature is the presence of new forces: Chinese and French forces, that enlarge and change the opening setup, introducing many new strategies. A new tactical point is introduced into the game through Bolster cards, a new type of cards that are played directly from the hand as reactions to game play. “Last but not least”, the introduction of new alternate “what if” cards, that represent historical strategies that were considered but never executed, as Operation Sea Lion, the invasion of Britain.

With these important changes the game is still simple to learn and quick to setup, but these new tactical moves at player’s disposal in this expansion set increase the fun and ensure a further and greater replayability!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Los Cazapedidos
boardgame.description:
Los Cazapedidos is a card game where up to four players face off to see who is the chef who gets the most points at the end of the game.
To win you must be the fastest to gather and combine ingredients to complete orders with references from pop culture elements like movies, TV series and video games; use the chef cards to gain advantage or annoy your opponents; and be careful with event cards that change the rules of the game.
A easy-to-learn game to play with family and friends.
So, if you've got 15 minutes to spare and you want to have fun playing in company, who you gonna call? Los Cazapedidos!

boardgame.name: Desperados: A Pen and Paper Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

The countryside passes by without the least sign of change, accompanied only by the wheels’ monotonous rattle on the rails. Noon has come; relentlessly the sun is blazing down from high above. Then, the eye distinguishes a solitary horseman on the horizon, and only a few seconds later a second one. From both sides, more and more horsemen are heading towards the train.

Welcome to the world of Desperados. Based on the award-winning video game franchise, this classic tabletop RPG aims to combine the best of both worlds: the challenging, tactical encounters of Desperados III and the freedom of choice and immersion one can only achieve with pen and paper.

The Wild West is a dangerous place; only the best will live long enough to give rise to their own legend.


Klappentext

Eintönig zieht die Landschaft an euch vorbei, nur begleitet durch das monotone Rattern der Schienen unter euch. Es ist Mittag und die Sonne steht unbarmherzig hoch am Himmel. Doch dann erscheint ein einsamer Reiter am Horizont, Sekunden später ein zweiter. Schließlich werden es immer mehr Reiter, die von beiden Seiten auf den Zug zuhalten.

Willkommen in der Welt von Desperados. Basierend auf dem preisgekrönten Videospiel-Franchise hat sich dieses klassische Pen & Paper Rollenspiel zum Ziel gesetzt, das beste aus beiden Welten zu vereinen: die herausfordernden, taktischen Gefechte aus Desperados III und die Freiheit und Immersion, die man nur mit Stift und Papier erreichen kann.

Der Wilde Westen ist ein gefährlicher Ort und nur die Besten überleben lange genug, um ihre eigene Legende zu schmieden.
boardgame.rpg: Desperados: A Pen and Paper Roleplaying
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Desperados: A Pen and Paper Roleplaying Game
Desperados: Ein Pen and Paper Rollenspiel

boardgame.name: Het Auris Verhalenspel
boardgame.description: In this cooperative game each round one player is the storyteller. He or she selects one of three storyline options on four consecutive story cards. Then the other players as a group have to guess which options the storyteller has chosen. The storyteller then reveals how many, buy not which choices were guessed right. Now the group can use communication cards, which asks the storyteller to give a hint - a word, a drawing, a musical hint, etc. After that, the group has to guess again. This is repeated until the right combination of story line options is guessed. Now another player becomes storyteller. Every story fully guessed right, earns a point. When there are no more communication cards, the game is over.

boardgame.name: Quantum Entanglement
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humanity has begun settling on planets circling other suns. Teleporters like myself and the new Leviathan jump ships can take anyone across the galaxy in a few hours, so the stars are at last within our reach. However, we have found dangers as well as wonders out there, and only by working together can we overcome them and take our place on the galactic stage.
- Bolade Atwan,
Proxy of Upeo wa Macho, November 2122

The Stars Await!

This jumpstart has everything you need to start playing an adventure in Trinity Continuum: Æon, including:

All the rules you need from Trinity Continuum, as well as specific rules for Trinity Continuum: Æon
A full adventure, “Quantum Entanglement,” ready to run
Five ready-made characters for players to pick up and play

boardgame.name: Renegade
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a hard hitting Marine is expelled from the Corps, he becomes an A-List mercenary. After a horrific injury, he is given a new bang with cybernetics! Now outfitted with next generation tech, he becomes a soldier of fortune for those that can afford the Renegade.

boardgame.name: The Blight of Fairwall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Everyone knows you don't go into the Fairwall woods. They say the town of Fairwall was less tha 5 miles from here . . . until the woods got angry and swalowed it whole."

The heroes must venture into the Fairwall woods, navigate the dangers within, and learn what is causing the spread of the darkness in this one-page adventure for 4-6 players of 1st level.

boardgame.name: Final Journey of the Couatl
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes must aid a dying Couatl in transporting a cursed suit of armour across the realm in this one-page adventure for 4-6 players of 3rd level.

Can the heroes resist the seduction of the demon trapped within the armor? Or will the demon's cultists recover the armor and bring about a new age of darkness?

boardgame.name: Villages - Winter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dotted across the landscape of every kingdom are hundreds and thousands of villages.
Discover: Villages Winter is a printable RPG floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.
Contents: A set of eight 20x20 battlemap depicting a variety of villages in different locations, during winter. Generic, river, forest and farmland.

Contents: A set of twenty battlemap tiles depicting the interior of different village houses, shops and more. Whilst they can be used on their own, they are best used for the interiors of the Discover:Villages set. Variant interiors for each house shape means you can change what's inside.

The Discover Range features surface battlemaps and different interiors. A variety of interiors is provided (separate product) for each building shape, allowing you to change what's inside each time you use the village.

boardgame.name: Tile Up
boardgame.description:
Tile Up is a fiendishly clever strategy game. Players try to score points by creating shapes out of their tiles that match goal cards. Easy enough, right? Not so fast! You can only place tiles on top of other tiles if the two tiles are different colors and the tile on top has a lower number than the tiles it is covering. The player with the most points at the end of the game, when the four corners of the gameboard have been covered with tiles, wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded – Solo Campaign Deck
boardgame.description:
The Run Fight or Die Solo Campaign allows you to play through a one player adventure using a base game copy of Run Fight or Die: Reloaded. The campaign spans four missions where you’ll need to gain the Followers, Leadership Points and Loot necessary to eventually defeat the Mutant Zombie, all while avoiding traumas that will hinder your efforts.

Contains:

15 Action Cards
15 Trauma Cards
4 Upgrade Cards
2 Mission Reference Cards
1 Supply Cache Card
1 Experience Card


Note: This was ncluded in the Run Fight or Die: Reloaded – Kickstarter Edition, but is sold separately for Retail editions via the publisher's website.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded – Kickstarter Edition

boardgame.name: Escape from Station 52
boardgame.description:
ESCAPE FROM STATION 52 is a roguelike solo card game where you, as the survivor Stella Hoshiko, have to escape from a space station that was taken over by a cosmic anomaly.

The deck consists of 52 cards, each not only representing the situations and threats that infest the station corridors, but also the weapons and equipment needed to deal with them.

Press forward through the Station, dealing with 4 cards at a time in search for the cards required to gain access to the Escape Pod. When unable to sneak past conflict, use Weapons and Gears, like the Flashbang to fend off Threats, or Emergency Kits to heal yourself.


ESCAPE FROM STATION 52 delivers tension and high lethality in a portable package of only 54 cards, with each play session lasting from 10 to 15 minutes.



Sneak past entire Corridors to avoid conflict and save your gear for another moment.



Arm yourself with the Flamethrower and the Exoskeleton to face off the cosmic anomalies that disrupt reality itself at Station 52!



Defeat the Amalgam, the major threat of Station 52 and survive to achieve victory as a Veteran.

boardgame.name: The Battle of Mimigawa 1578
耳川の戦い
耳川の戦い
boardgame.description:
Mimigawa is a battle fought on 10 December 1578 between the Ōtomo clan and Shimazu clans. It ended in a decisive Shimazu victory.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Mimigawa

In 1578, Sorin Otomo, who was the largest Sengoku Daimyo in Kyushu, protected Asahi Ito, who had lost Hyuga after the Shimazu invasion. In an attempt to recapture Hyuga and expand the power of Christianity, he attacked. Shimazu forces pushed forward the army of Otomo's army and crossed the Ogawa.

Battle of Mimikawa is a wargame on the Shimazu vs. Otomo battle, also known as the Battle of Takashirogawa.

This game adopts the chit driven system in which "activating chits" are assigned to each unit of both sides. It reproduces medieval battles where actions can be uncontroled.

Game scale

1 hex = approx. 100 m
1 unit = 250-500 soldiers


Number of players = 2　
Play time = 120 minutes

Contents (excluding magazines)

160 pieces (15mm square)
1 map (1 A1 size)
1 rule book (12 pages)


(adapted and translated from Command Japan website)

boardgame.name: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
boardgame.description:
Some Secrets are Worth Dying For. Feel the cold touch of death in this adventure for the world’s greatest roleplaying game.

An adventure for a party of adventurers levels 1 - 12.

In Icewind Dale, adventure is a dish best served cold. Beneath the unyielding night sky, you stand before a towering glacier and recite an ancient rhyme, causing a crack to form in the great wall of ice. Beyond this yawning fissure, the Caves of Hunger await. And past this icy dungeon is a secret so old and terrifying that few dare speak of it. The mad wizards of the Arcane Brotherhood long to possess that which the god of winter’s wrath has so coldly preserved—as do you! What fantastic secrets and treasures are entombed in the sunless heart of the glacier, and what will their discovery mean for the denizens of Icewind Dale? Can you save Ten-Towns from the Frostmaiden’s everlasting night?

Adventure to Icewind Dale, the beloved setting made famous by Drizzt Do'Urden and the Companions of the Hall and experience D&D in a way that you've never seen before. Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden is a tale of dark terror that revisits the forlorn, flickering candlelights of civilization known as Ten-Towns and sheds light on the many bone-chilling locations that surround these frontier settlements.

boardgame.name: The Transcontinental
boardgame.description:
In 1871, with Canada only four years old, the Prime Minister calls for a massive undertaking: a transcontinental railway to link the established eastern provinces with the newly-added western province. Between them lay the vast, undeveloped interior. It would be a nation-defining project, opening up the resource-rich Canadian shield, the fertile prairies, and the breathtaking Rocky Mountain Cordillera, shaping not only the economy of the young country but its identity as well.

The Transcontinental is a medium-weight Eurogame with worker-placement and pick-up and deliver mechanisms about the development of the Canadian transcontinental railway.

Players are contractors who work to complete the railway. They send out telegrams along a linear worker-placement track — reserving those action spaces for themselves — then take turns in telegram order, loading and unloading to a shared train that travels across the country. Players can use these resources to complete developments ranging from lumber mills and farms to cities and national parks, or they can use the resources to bid to extend the railway. Powerful one-time-use ally cards, themed around a rich and inclusive cast of Canadian historical figures, allow players to make powerful combined actions.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2019 Canadian Game Design Award Winner

VainGlorious: France 1940

boardgame.name: Street Wars
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

New York City is in a constant state of chaos under the thumb of organized crime. The heroes are faced with an opportunity to stem the ever-growing tide of violence once and for all. How much are they willing to sacrifice to achieve their goal of cleaning up the streets? Is it worth their reputation and the lives of those they hold most dear?

Street Wars is a full-length campaign for a small group or single player adventure for the Classic Marvel Superheroes RPG. This book contains everything you need to play a street level campaign set on the mean streets of New York City, including a multichapter adventure book, maps, Player Characters and NPCs.
boardgame.rpgseries: MH - Marvel Super Heroes RPG Adventures

boardgame.name: Cafe Christa
boardgame.description: A co-operative dice-and-cards board game wherein players collaborate to try and serve customers at a cafe each course of their meal in order. Dedicated to the memory of the designer's daughter, an accomplished chef and baker. It can also be played solo.

boardgame.name: Anita Blake - Vampire Hunter Handbook
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

Sourcebook for the Marvel Super Heroes RPG detailing the world of Anita Blake, Vampire Hunter, as described in the Marvel Comics.

boardgame.name: Entirely Plausible Journey
boardgame.description:
The Phlegbonian Ambassador is ill and the fate of the universe hangs in the balance!

This is a sci-fi space opera with a difference.
Instead of cruising the outer reaches, Space Patrol will be shrunk down to microscopic size to battle a disease that is killing the alien physiology of the ambassador.

The scenarios are written as a supplement for Quick Intermediate Level Skirmish, free rule set.
Designer's notes and guidelines help port the game to any game system you want.
There are also suggestions on how to tweak the scenario with hints and tips learned tweaking the scenario during playtest.

It contains:

Scenario with simple rules to create a dynamic, challenging alien physiology
Simple print and play terrain bits so you can run the game rightr away
Loads of playtested suggestions for variants, so it's the scenario that keeps on giving


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: It Takes Two (2021)
boardgame.description:
Embark on the craziest journey of your life in It Takes Two, a genre-bending platform adventure created purely for co-op. Invite a friend to join for free with Friend’s Pass* and work together across a huge variety of gleefully disruptive gameplay challenges. Play as the clashing couple Cody and May, two humans turned into dolls by a magic spell. Together, trapped in a fantastical world where the unpredictable hides around every corner, they are reluctantly challenged with saving their fractured relationship.

Master unique and connected character abilities in every new level. Help each other across an abundance of unexpected obstacles and laugh-out-loud moments. Kick gangster squirrels’ furry tails, pilot a pair of underpants, DJ a buzzing night club, and bobsleigh through a magical snow globe. Embrace a heartfelt and hilarious story, where narrative and gameplay are interwoven in a uniquely metaphorical experience.

It Takes Two is developed by the award-winning studio Hazelight, the industry-leader of cooperative play. They are about to take you on a wild and wondrous ride where only one thing is for certain: we’re better together.

KEY FEATURES:
PURE CO-OP PERFECTION – Invite a friend to join for free with Friend’s Pass*, and experience a thrilling adventure built purely for two. Choose from couch or online co-op with split-screen play, and face ever-changing challenges where working together is the only way forward.

GLEEFULLY DISRUPTIVE GAMEPLAY – From rampaging vacuum cleaners to suave love gurus – with It Takes Two, you never know what you’re up against next. Filled with genre-bending challenges and new character abilities to master in every level, you’ll experience a metaphorical merging of gameplay and narrative that pushes the boundaries of interactive storytelling.

A UNIVERSAL TALE OF RELATIONSHIPS – Discover a touching and heartfelt story of the challenges in getting along. Help Cody and May learn how to overcome their differences. Meet a diverse cast of strange and endearing characters. Join forces, and go on an adventure you’ll treasure – together!

boardgame.name: Charty Party: All Ages Edition
boardgame.description:
The absurdly funny game of ridiculous charts!

If you like bizarre charts, goofy card games, and want a fresh game for your next party night, give Charty Party a try!

How to play?

Every player draw 7 cards
All the players choose a judge from themselves, who will draw a chart card.
Everyone play a card by passing it face-down to the judge. Choose the funniest card which fits with the chart card.
The judge chooses the funniest card related to the chart card, giving one point to the owner of the card.
You can play the number of rounds you want. At the end, the player with the most points win the game!

—description from the designer

Quick Overview

The Villagers Playmats come bundled with promo cards and a replacement card pack. It is made of fabric-covered neoprene and helps to keep the road organised while making it easier to pick up cards. It measures 30 x 70cm and has a bound edge with rounded corners.

The Promo Pack adds two copies each of two new solitary villagers, the Plower and the Scribe, which can be used at any player count - just shuffle them into your deck and go! There's also a player aid card for the single player mode to help you get to grips with the solo turn structure.

boardgame.name: Urbe: For the King
boardgame.description:
Urbe: For the King is a fast and fun tile placement game where the players will compete to create the most beautiful and well organized City, trying to obey to the Royal Decrees issued from His Majesty, the King.

Each player will represent a Guildmaster who will try to be the most influential on the Kingdom using their specific tools, Coin Cards, to outperform the other Guilds in creating the most efficient and beautiful City for His Majesty.

By gaining City Tiles through placing their Emissaries and wittingly using Coin Cards, players will try to beco­me the best builder, thus being appointed by the King himself.

Fountains will enrich the City as new neighbourhoods are built, so you will be able to surprise the King creating even more beautiful Cities than he required.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: La Bataille de Hagelberg 1813
boardgame.description:
La Bataille de Hagelberg, 1813 recreates a neglected but key battle in, what was then considered, Brandenburg during the opening of the fall German campaign in 1813. The French commander, General Jean-Baptiste Girard, was commanding the Magdeburg Garrison and had been asked to support Marshal Oudinot in his drive towards Berlin. He was faced by a mainly Landwehr force commanded by Prussian General Karl Friedrich von Hirschfeld and supported by the Cossack General Alexandr Chernyshev. The Prussians and the Russians were given the task of stopping Girard’s French from joining Oudinot’s army.

The Battle of Hagelberg was a bitter battle, held on the same day as the Battle of Dresden. Though the casualties were high on both sides, the Coalition prevailed and stopped Girard from affecting a union of the French forces approaching Berlin.

Notes:
1. Use the Premier Rules, with combat and fire charts, and markers from previous ME releases.
2. Contained in La Bataille de Berlin 1813
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: La Bataille (Clash of Arms Games)

boardgame.name: Tommy's wereldspel
boardgame.description:
In this game you have to deliver packages around the world. You start with only a small van which can only hold one package, later on in the game you can buy a truck, which holds three packages, and a plane with room for two, but which can travel a lot further. Each turn you throw two dies to determine what you are allowed to do this turn: drive (this includes flying), get a new deliverance order, get a quality card, or choose one of the above. The world map is divided in squares, each square costs hunderd euros to travel over. Each deliverance order costs you a starting fee, but once you delivered the goods, you get paid.
The first person who maken 50.000 euros wind the game.

Content: game board - play money - 40 shipments - 12 game pieces - 12 transport tokens - 4 depots - 4 petrol stations - 4 player cards - 54 quality cards - 56 shipment cards - 2 dice - game rules.

boardgame.name: Anomaly
boardgame.description:
From the itch.io page:
Anomaly is a Tarot based gmless storytelling game about a sinister organization investigating a supernatural anomaly.

Anomaly works best with 2-5 players, and games take between two and four hours.

Players define the nature of the organization, the team of researchers they have sent, the anomaly, and the setting it's found itself in, then develop the story of the investigation by drawing Tarot cards and answering associated questions.

boardgame.name: Fanhunter: El juego de rol epicodecadente (3rd Ed.)
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:
En el siniestro futuro del siglo XXI solo hay CHORRADAS...

Alejo I, un ex-librero demente que tiene delirios de grandeza y cree estar poseído por el espíritu del escritor Philip K. Dick (pues eso, demente) ha conquistado buena parte del mundo, rebautizándolo como Reino de Dick e imponiendo una dictadura criminal en la que todas las manifestaciones de subcultura pop han sido prohibidas: los cómics de superhéroes, los videojuegos roguelike, el rocanrol, las sitcoms, los wargames, las pelis de Steve Seagal (bueno, a ver, esto aún)...

Las tropas del terror de Alejo, los despiadados Fanhunter y los clónicos macutes persiguen y exterminan a todos los cinéfilos, roleros, otakus, trekkies, cosplayers y demás frikis vacacionales, que se han organizado contra el tirano formando la Resistencia, posiblemente el grupo insurgente más inepto de la historia.

Fanhunter, el juego de rol epicodecadente y postchorrapunk, está basado en los célebres tebeos de Cels Piñol, el autor que ha necesitado 30 años para aprender a dibujar rodillas. En esta renovadísima edición de Fanhunter encontrarás:


Un sistema de juego que garantizamos que NO FUNCIONA, con lo cual ya no tienes que preocuparte por si aplicas mal las reglas.
Un 600% más de contenido útil (teniendo en cuenta que la edición anterior no tenía ninguno), incluyendo, por primera vez, un tocho-trasfondo ordenado y comprensible del universo Fanhunter.
Un 35% más de humor escatológico, pensado para ofender a la mayor variedad posible de colectivos (salvo quizás a los filatélicos, diríamos que a todos).
Una colección de erratas exclusivas, en cantidad sorprendente incluso para un libro editado por Devir.


Fanhunter ha vuelto, ¡Y es más caro que nunca! ¿Te lo vas a perder? (ah... ¿sí? Hostia... pues estábamos seguros de que ya te teníamos en el bote).

boardgame.name: TOBITO
飛人
boardgame.description:
TOBITO is a pure abstract strategy game for multiple players. The goal is simple: Move your three pieces to the three spaces on the opposite side of the board before your opponents can do so. Players may jump over opposing pieces, which they then relocate. You will find it's not easy to progress at times because of your opponent's movement and re-location of your pieces.

Each player has three colored pieces with reversible faces to show their goal sign. Each player sets their three pieces, plain color up, on their three starting spaces. A turn is made by moving one of your pieces. Passing your turn isn't allowed.

You can move any one of your pieces to an unoccupied space in any of eight directions (horizontally, vertically or diagonally). You may move a piece by jumping over any number of adjacent pieces, whether your own or an opponent's, onto a vacant space. When jumped, your pieces stay where they are, but opposing pieces must be relocated to a vacant space.

Once a piece reaches the goal, you flip it over, and that piece is now immobile. You can't move it, and opposing players can't jump over it because it can't be relocated.

At the end of your turn, if you haven't won and all of your starting spaces are occupied with pieces — whether yours or others — you are out of the game. If more than one player remains in the game, remove all of your pieces from the board. Continue the game to determine the winner.

The first player to move their three pieces to the opposite side of the board or the last active player still in the game wins.

boardgame.name: The Cards of Cthulhu
boardgame.description:
The Cards of Cthulhu (PnP Version) is a single player thematic card game for use with a standard deck of playing cards and some six-sided dice. It was developed by Ian Richard for the 24 Hour Contest in November 2012.

Cards are divided into Cultists (numbered cards), Horrors (royal cards), and Planetary Alignments (aces). Each suit represents a different cult trying to summon an Elder God.

Each round of gameplay proceeds in two phases, drawing a card and placing it within its respective cult and engaging in combat with dice. Cultists may be defeated by corresponding numerical combinations of dice. Horrors must be resolved first and require special dice combinations. An additional card is drawn for each Planetary Alignment that comes into play. Defeated cards serve as trophies that may be traded for artifacts and spells that improve the chances of success.

The game ends if five Cultists of any suit come into play at the same time to summon an Elder God or you successfully play all cards in the deck while preventing this from happening.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: The Cards of Cthulhu: Beyond the Veil

boardgame.name: Galleys, Guns and Glory!
boardgame.description:
Galleys Guns and Glory! is designed to play table top naval battles with fleets of cannon packing oared vessels, in a time frame from roughly 1500- 1650. The rules are designed to work at “convention level”, which means you can learn the rules in less than 5 minutes, get into action- making a couple of n00b moves,(or spectacular maneuvers) and come away with a story or two to tell at the bar.

Management of each ship and its crew are visual and easy to account for as the crew and damage to the ship are represented on the models- leaving little to no paperwork!

Although trying to capture the essence of the period and referencing strongly the doctrines and tactics of the time, I claim no absolute historical accuracy, other than like the galleys of yore my ships are made of wood and are adorned with such opulent awnings, lanterns, flags and bulwark side trim that would make the Sultan’s harem jealous.

Galleys Guns and Glory! is designed for oared naval actions ranging in scale from small corsair raids of a few ships to “epic” grand battle re-fights such as Lepanto- with over 100 ships! With an emphasis on maneuvering, the brutality of gun fire, sky darkening fusillades of small arms and intense melee boarding actions that would ebb and flow across ships, GGG! has something for everyone!

—description from the designer

Play through the childhood and fight, together with your dog against pirates, aliens and underwater to save your best friend.


Big Fish Studios is proud to present Fetch, an adventure tale that will warm your heart and keep you touching the screen for more! One part interactive animation, one part childhood delight, equal parts adventure and arcade, Fetch captures the timeless emotion of puppy love and takes you on a journey through dark tunnels and sandy shores to save your best friend. Do you have what it takes to save Bear? Prepare yourself for a wild ride filled with wagging tails and boisterous barks!

* Battle hilarious aliens; discover a prehistoric ocean; build a robot; pilot a rocket ship, and more!

Dive in to a living animated world
